channel.title: Client compiling error
channel.description:
hi guys, whenever i compile, i get this,
Class8.java:1260: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: byte[] class8.aByteArray178 = "An ancient kiteshield used by the warriors of bandos."; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
its pointing to the first qoute for the examination code, i dont get it, putting brackets and stuff around a qoute doesnt sound like it will work..... what do i do? im not very familiar with client errors *edit* hold it wrong section

item.title: Client compiling error
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

again, wrong section, but thanks chaos, it worked!

Read full topic

item.title: Client compiling error
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You wrote a string when it wants a byte.

class8.aByteArray178 = "An ancient kiteshield used by the warriors of bandos.".getBytes();

Read full topic

item.title: Client compiling error
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

hi guys, whenever i compile, i get this,

Class8.java:1260: incompatible types
found : java.lang.String
required: byte[]
class8.aByteArray178 = “An ancient kiteshield used by the warriors of bandos.”;
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

its pointing to the first qoute for the examination code,
i dont get it, putting brackets and stuff around a qoute doesnt sound like it will work…
what do i do? im not very familiar with client errors
edit
hold it wrong section

Read full topic
